front.title: Performance Measurement Using RFC 6374 for Segment Routing Networks with MPLS Data Plane

abstract.t: Segment Routing (SR) leverages the source routing paradigm. SR is applicable to Multiprotocol Label Switching data plane (SR-MPLS) as specified in RFC 8402. RFC 6374 specifies protocol mechanisms to enable the efficient and accurate measurement of packet loss, one-way and two-way delay, as well as related metrics such as delay variation in MPLS networks. This document utilizes these mechanisms for Performance Delay and Loss Measurements in SR-MPLS networks, for both SR-MPLS links and end-to-end SR-MPLS paths including Policies. In addition, this document defines Return Path TLV and Block Number TLV extensions for RFC 6374.
